thread.title: Thundelarra: Panoramic Resources' Savannah Nth could have 2km strike
thread.title_full: Thundelarra: Panoramic Resources' Savannah Nth could have 2km strike | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  Australia
title: Thundelarra: Panoramic Resources' Savannah Nth could have 2km strike
text:
(MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)Thundelarra ( ASX:THX ) has a free carried 20% interest and exposure to significant nickel mineralisation after Panoramic Resources ( ASX:PAN ) confirmed that its Savannah North nickel sulphide discovery extends west into their joint venture tenement.

The free carry is in E80/4834 Keller Creek Tenement in Western Australia’s Eastern Kimberley region held by Panoramic.

Panoramic’s recent geophysical surveys indicated the total strike extent of the Savannah North mineralised now approaches 2 kilometres and remains open to the west.

Adding interest the most recent hole at its wholly-owned ML80/180 intersected 25.95 metres of massive sulphide mineralisation grading 2.55% nickel 1.49% copper and 0.17% cobalt.

Interim resources have been estimated at 3.15 million tonnes grading 1.75% for 55200 tonnes of contained nickel increasing total inventory at Panoramic’s Savannah Project to 128800 tonnes.

Savannah North is expected to eventually be developed by underground extension and drives from the existing Savannah underground mine operations.
Savannah produced 8726 tonnes of nickel 5314 tonnes of copper and 443 tonnes of cobalt in FY2015.

Panoramic Survey 

Panoramic has been conducting exploration and resource definition drill programs at Savannah over the past 12 months.

The western surface hole SMD164 intersected 5.05 metres at 2.62% nickel 0.16% copper and 0.10% cobalt extending the previous western limit of the Savannah North mineralisation by at least 250 metres to the west and beyond the limit of detection of the original DHEM fixed surface loop.

A DHEM survey was subsequently carried out at the hole increasing the potential western extent of the Savannah North mineralisation.

This interpretation projects the mineralised horizon to the west across the boundary of ML80/180 (100% Panoramic) and onto E80/4834.

Notably this remains open to the west.

Analysis

That Panoramic Resources ’ Savannah North nickel sulphide mineralisation could extend into Keller Creek Tenement where Thundelarra has a free-carried 20% interest is significant and material.

It offers potential for Thundelarra to enjoy a share of nickel copper and cobalt production at little risk given that Savannah North will almost certainly be an extension of the existing Savannah underground mine.

As an example of this potential shares in Talisman Mining ( ASX:TLM ) have risen 200% to 0.51 since partner Sandfire Resources announced in mid-June a discovery of massive sulphides at the Monty Prospect near its DeGrussa Copper Mine.

Sandfire is earning up to 70% interest in Talisman’s Doolgunna Prjects by sole-funding up to 15 million in exploration expenditure.   
Thundelarra had 5 million in cash as at 30th June 2015. This excludes equity investments worth about 117000 as well as settlement of the final 9 tranche from the sale of the Hayes Creek Uranium assets that is due by 30th October 2015.
